title: Data on individual churches
text: Get tidy data Church England churches.
code: coe_church_data(where = "ChurchCode = 608186") |>   dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 11 #> $ church_code       <int> 608186 #> $ parish_name       <chr> "Leytonstone: St Margaret w St Columba" #> $ parish_code       <int> 580186 #> $ benefice_name     <chr> "Leytonstone St Marg w St Columba" #> $ benefice_id       <chr> "08/265 M" #> $ deanery_name      <chr> "WALTHAM FOREST" #> $ deanery_id        <int> 58108 #> $ archdeaconry_name <chr> "WEST HAM" #> $ archdeaconry_id   <int> 581 #> $ diocese_name      <chr> "Chelmsford" #> $ diocese_number    <int> 8

title: Data on individual churches
text: Get parish code given church(es).

title: Data on individual churches
text: tiny function returns names fields used Feature Server Churches provided CoE Data Services ESRI.

title: Reading CoE statistics
text: Display information datasets available package. Default return two-column tibble including nomis_code description, setting description = FALSE return character vector valid nomis codes can passed functions coe_stats()
code: coe_datasets() |>   dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 15 #> Columns: 2 #> $ nomis_code  <chr> "TS001", "TS004", "TS007A", "TS021", "TS030", "TS037", "TS… #> $ description <chr> "TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and commu…

title: Reading CoE statistics
text: Get statistics particular topic, particular geographical level, filtering required. Levels include ‘parish’, ‘diocese’ ‘england’. Parishes can filtered parish codes dioceses diocese numbers, national-level tables comprised single row filtered.
code: coe_stats(nomis_code =  "TS001", level = "england") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   population lives_in_a_household lives_in_a_communal_establishment #>        <dbl>                <dbl>                             <dbl> #> 1   56506784            55542946.                           963838. coe_stats(nomis_code = "TS001", level = "diocese", areas = 1) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   diocese_name diocese_number population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>        <chr>               <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 Bath & Wells 1                  979315              959638. #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>

title: Reading CoE statistics
code: coe_parish_in_context(parish_code = "370047", nomis_codes = "TS001") #> ✔ Reading from coeparishdata_parish-data. #> ✔ Range ''TS001''. #> $TS001 #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   level  level_code level_name                population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>  <chr>      <chr>                          <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 parish 370047     South Dulwich: St Stephen       6680                0.983 #> 2 parish 37         Southwark                    2879124                0.988 #> 3 nation NA         england                     56506784                0.983 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>

what: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: coeparishdata data package ’s built around various datasets made available Church England’s Data Services team. Data sources include: Parish-level census data ONS’ 2021 Census England Wales (Updated November 2024) database Churches, Parishes, Dioceses geographies (Updated November 2024) Parish-level data 2019 Index Multiple Deprivation (PENDING)

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: can install development version coeparishdata GitHub :

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: Full documentation website : https://Church-Army.github.io/coeparishdata

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: Add data-dictionary vignettes Create print methods "coe_parish_data" class Create methods dplyr preserve attributes "coe_parish_data" objects Add IMD data Ensure appropriate credit/attribution/documentation

what: Get church-level data from CoE data services — coe_church_data
title: Get church-level data from CoE data services — coe_church_data
text: Reads church data Church England's Data Services ESRI feature server, dropping spatial data returning tibble::tibble().

title: Get church-level data from CoE data services — coe_church_data
Get church-level data from CoE data services — coe_church_data
text: SQL query. default returns churches. See details.

title: Get church-level data from CoE data services — coe_church_data
text: tibble row corresponds church Church England

title: Get church-level data from CoE data services — coe_church_data
text: function renames fields returned tibble, query passed must use original names ESRI data provided CoE data services. names fields can accessed via coe_esri_fields()

what: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_in_context
title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_in_context
text: Extracts parish, diocese national level data given parish, base::rbinds single table. Iterates nomis_codes output list tables

title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_in_context
code: coe_parish_in_context(   parish_code,   nomis_codes = coe_datasets(description = FALSE),   relative = TRUE )

title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_in_context
text: parish_code single parish code. Character. nomis_codes character vector nomis_codes. relative Logical. outputs relative? Default TRUE.

title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_in_context
text: list coe_parish_data tibbles

title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_in_context
code: coe_parish_in_context(parish_code = "370047", nomis_codes = "TS001") #> ✔ Reading from coeparishdata_parish-data. #> ✔ Range ''TS001''. #> $TS001 #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   level  level_code level_name                population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>  <chr>      <chr>                          <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 parish 370047     South Dulwich: St Stephen       6680                0.983 #> 2 parish 37         Southwark                    2879124                0.988 #> 3 nation NA         england                     56506784                0.983 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl> #>

what: Get Census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_stats
title: Get Census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_stats
text: Get Census data Church England parish, diocesan national level.

title: Get Census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_stats
Get Census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_stats
text: nomis_code Nomis code required data. Must one coe_datasets(). level geographical level data required. Must one 'parish', 'diocese' 'england'. areas character vector parish codes diocese numbers. specified, returned tibble contain data areas. used level = 'england'. NA values removed. relative Logical. returned table contain absolute statitiscs (e.g. persons/households) proportions area?

title: Get Census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_stats
code: coe_stats(nomis_code =  "TS001", level = "england") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   population lives_in_a_household lives_in_a_communal_establishment #>        <dbl>                <dbl>                             <dbl> #> 1   56506784            55542946.                           963838. coe_stats(nomis_code = "TS001", level = "diocese", areas = 1) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   diocese_name diocese_number population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>        <chr>               <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 Bath & Wells 1                  979315              959638. #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>
